title: Bloom’s Taxonomy-Based Rapid Mobile Microlearning Mathematics Course

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level basic mathematics knowledge and workplace data interpretation experience
context.additional_context: Modular content (5–10 minutes) optimized for smartphone-based learning environments, structured around practical cases applicable to work

learning_goals: Learners can explain mathematical problem-solving processes according to Bloom's Taxonomy six levels (Remember-Understand-Apply-Analyze-Evaluate-Create).
Learners gain the ability to interpret statistical data provided in mobile environments for business decision-making.
Learners complete two mobile microlearning modules per week and achieve 80%+ proficiency in the final evaluation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
